text.headline: Create Skill in Project
text.text: Develop skill in project repository at ~/Documents/textbook-project/skills/new-skill/ with SKILL.md and supporting files.

events.notes: Original files are version controlled in the project repository. This keeps skills organized with the project they support.

text.headline: Run Install Script
text.text: Execute ./scripts/install-claude-skills.sh to create symlinks in global skills directory.

events.notes: The install script automates symlink creation, eliminating manual file copying and ensuring changes stay synchronized.

text.headline: Symlinks Created
text.text: Script creates symlinks at ~/.claude/skills/ pointing back to project skills directory.

events.notes: Symlinks (symbolic links) point to original files without duplicating them. Changes to original files are immediately reflected.

text.headline: Claude Code Discovery
text.text: Claude Code searches ~/.claude/skills/ directory and discovers the new skill via symlink.

events.notes: Claude Code automatically scans the global skills directory on startup and when skills are invoked. No manual registration required.

text.headline: Load SKILL.md
text.text: Claude Code reads SKILL.md file to understand the skill's capabilities, workflow, and requirements.

events.notes: The SKILL.md file contains the skill definition with YAML frontmatter (name, description) and detailed workflow instructions.

text.headline: Skill Available for Use
text.text: Skill is now registered and can be invoked with /skill command or Skill tool.

events.notes: Once loaded, the skill can be invoked by name. Updates to the original files are immediately available without reinstallation.

text.headline: Update Skill (Optional)
text.text: Edit files in project skills directory. Changes immediately available to Claude Code through symlink.

events.notes: This is the key benefit of symlinks: modify the original skill files and the changes are instantly available without running install script again.

text.headline: Version Control (Optional)
text.text: Commit skill changes to Git repository for version tracking and sharing.

events.notes: Skills in the project directory can be versioned with Git, pushed to GitHub, and shared with others. The ~/.claude/skills/ directory should not be version controlled.
